name: TheAtlantic
text: The new postmaster general's cost-cutting steps have led to delivery delays. The Trump administration's hostility toward USPS instigated "unnecessary and politically manufactured" crises—putting jobs and communities at risk, Philip F. Rubio wrote in April: https://t.co/hE127HhXdt

name: TheAtlantic
text: "In Biden, Democrats have a nominee who is promising FDR-style change," @PeterBeinart writes, "yet is avoiding the political backlash that an ambitious progressive agenda often brings." https://t.co/u7AnElRism

name: TheAtlantic
text:
"The happiest place on Earth" may be situated in a coronavirus hot spot, but Disney's superfans persist—even if it means donning masks in the Florida heat and feeling occasional pangs of anxiety. @shirklesxp reports:
https://t.co/Y8Gvqih4lt

name: TheAtlantic
text: A Democratic effort to help Kris Kobach win the GOP Senate nomination in Kansas is unnerving the party’s staunchest immigrant advocates, @russellberman reports: https://t.co/JFiFpXbnLp

name: TheAtlantic
text: With its first passengers, two NASA astronauts, now home from space, SpaceX predicts paying customers might make the same trip “not too long from now,” @marinakoren reports: https://t.co/1dY3YBHmXo

name: TheAtlantic
text: The Islamic State turned Facebook into a global marketplace for looted artifacts. These vigilante archaeologists are trying to stop it, @Jenna_Scatena reports. https://t.co/Yrb22NmD7V

name: TheAtlantic
text: "I’ve been hauling balloons into my apartment recently, great gaggles of them, in the interest of general mood elevation. There have been occasions, too, moments to mark: birthdays, graduations, whatever. They’re over. But the balloons remain...." https://t.co/TIy1MJ5OXc

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Archaeology operates within a contemporary setting and can contribute to conversations we are having today about how history is memorialized," @dmcarballo tells @DavidFrum: https://t.co/ghagKP3hzX

name: TheAtlantic
text: Listen as @JasonWardNY joins @katlwells & @jameshamblin to guide them through a pandemic-compatible hobby: birding. https://t.co/inuJAi2M8c

name: TheAtlantic
text: Small businesses have played a big role in revitalizing towns across America—but the pandemic is straining them. @JamesFallows on two local brewing companies and how they're surviving: https://t.co/36d2IK5pv2

name: TheAtlantic
text: Cases will wax and wane over time, but this virus is never going away, @sarahzhang writes: https://t.co/Ynx9lq7Rzx

name: TheAtlantic
text: The Atlantic Daily: 5 Ways America Has Failed During the Pandemic, by @mimbsy https://t.co/6lLLC0V9K4
